entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 10.10 a-b** *आहृताः क्रतवो मुख्याः ... भरतसत्तम ||१०||*
How many main sacrifices were brought?
A) Hundred (शतं) B) Thousand (सहस्रं) C) Ten (दश) D) Hundred (शतं)
entry.answer: A) Hundred (शतं) • Verse states "hundred of Bharata's best" — the missing word is "शतं" (hundred). • Other options are numbers mentioned elsewhere but not in this context. • "भरतसत्तम" (best of Bharata) is a title, not a number.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 11.11 a-b** *यत्र यूपा मणिमयाश्चित्याश्चापि ... हिरण्मयाः ||११||*
What were the posts made of?
A) Gems (मणिमयाः) B) Gold (हिरण्मयाः) C) Silver (स्वर्णमयाः) D) Stone (शिलामयाः)
entry.answer: B) Gold (हिरण्मयाः) • Verse specifies "gold" (हिरण्मयाः) for the posts. • "मणिमयाः" (gem-studded) is a separate descriptor. • Other options are materials mentioned elsewhere but not in this context.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 13.13 a-b** *नरनारायणौ ... यमः स्थाणुश्च पञ्चमः ||१३||*
Who are the deities worshipped in the sacrifice?
A) Nara and Narayana (नरनारायणौ) B) Brahma (ब्रह्मा) C) Yama (यमः) D) Sthāṇu (स्थाणुश्च)
entry.answer: A) Nara and Narayana (नरनारायणौ) • Verse explicitly names Nara and Narayana as the deities. • Other options are separate entities (Brahma, Yama, Sthāṇu). • "Nara and Narayana" are often associated with Vishnu and Arjuna.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 16.16 a-b** *तत्र गत्वा स जग्राह गदां शङ्खं च ... ||१६||*
Who took the mace and conch?
A) Bhima (भीमसेन) B) Arjuna (पार्थ) C) Yudhishthira (युधिष्ठिर) D) Bharata (भारत)
entry.answer: D) Bharata (भारत) • Verse states "he took the mace and conch, Bharata" — the missing word is "भारत" (Bharata). • Other options are warriors but not the subject here. • "Bharata" refers to the king or a title, not a specific warrior.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 18.18 a-b** *गदां च भीमसेनाय ... ददौ शङ्खमनुत्तमम् ||१८||*
To whom was the mace given?
A) Bhimasena (भीमसेन) B) Arjuna (पार्थ) C) Yudhishthira (युधिष्ठिर) D) Kṛṣṇa (कृष्ण)
entry.answer: A) Bhimasena (भीमसेन) • Verse states "he gave the mace to Bhimasena" — the missing word is "भीमसेनाय". • Other options are warriors but not the recipient here. • "Bhimasena" is a key character associated with the mace.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 19.19 a-b** *सभा तु सा महाराज ... दश किष्कुसहस्राणि ||१९||*
How many thousand of what were present?
A) Ten thousand (दश किष्कुसहस्राणि) B) Hundred thousand (शत किष्कुसहस्राणि) C) One thousand (एक किष्कुसहस्राणि) D) Ten (दश)
entry.answer: A) Ten thousand (दश कि�ष्कुसहस्राणि) • Verse specifies "ten thousand" (दश कि�ष्कुसहस्राणि) as the number. • Other options are numbers but not the exact phrase. • "Kishkusha" refers to a type of tree or a group, but the number is key here.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 27.27 a-b** *तां सभामभितो नित्यं पुष्पवन्तो महाद्रुमाः ||२७||*
What kind of trees were present in the assembly?
A) Flowering (पुष्पवन्तो) B) Sacred (महाद्रुमाः) C) Golden (सुवर्णमयाः) D) Diamond (मणिमयाः)
entry.answer: A) Flowering (पुष्पवन्तो) • Verse states "flowering trees" (पुष्पवन्तो) were present. • "Mahādruṃ" (great trees) is a descriptor but not the missing word. • Other options are materials or colors mentioned elsewhere.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 30.30 a-b** *मणिरत्नचितां तां तु केचिदभ्येत्य पार्थिवाः ||३०||*
Who approached the assembly?
A) Kings (पार्थिवाः) B) Sages (ऋषयः) C) Warriors (क्षत्रियाः) D) Merchants (व्यापारिणः)
entry.answer: A) Kings (पार्थिवाः) • Verse states "kings approached the assembly" — the missing word is "पार्थिवाः". • Other options are groups mentioned elsewhere but not the subject here. • "Pārthivāḥ" (kings) is the direct term for rulers.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 34.34 a-b** *निष्ठितां धर्मराजाय मयो राज्ञे न्यवेदयत् ||३४||*
Who did Mayā (the architect) present the assembly to?
A) Yudhishthira (धर्मराजाय) B) Bhima (भीमसेन) C) Arjuna (पार्थ) D) Kṛṣṇa (कृष्ण)
entry.answer: A) Yudhishthira (धर्मराजाय) • Verse states "Maya presented the assembly to the king" — the missing word is "धर्मराजाय" (Yudhishthira). • Other options are warriors but not the recipient here. • "Dharmarājā" is a title for Yudhishthira.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 100.100 a-b** *कथं वै सफला वेदाः कथं वै सफलं धनम् ||१००||*
How are the Vedas successful?
A) Through Agnihotra (अग्निहोत्रफला) B) Through wealth (धनम्) C) Through knowledge (ज्ञानम्) D) Through rituals (क्रिया)
entry.answer: A) Through Agnihotra (अग्निहोत्रफला) • Verse states "Vedas are successful through Agnihotra" — the missing word is "अग्निहोत्रफला". • Other options are abstract concepts but not the direct answer. • "Agnihotra" is a specific ritual mentioned in the text.
